Multiple conspiracy: minded websites published near-identical stories about the alleged discovery of a giant human footprint in China.
The initial spark of the story came from: language site of the Chinese content aggregator Sino, which did not provide any details regarding the footprint's dimensions.
An exhaustive search of terms related to: footprints, fossils, and photographers for stories published in Guizhou's local paper in August 2016 turned up zero results, indicating a lack of evidence supporting the claim.
Factually dubious and unrelated claims a: including the claim that an archaeologist named Michael Tellinger dated a purported giant humanoid footprint to be around 200 million years old.
